summary: In 2018, Medicare paid over $2 billion for anesthesia services such as those needed for surgery. In 2007, we reported that private insurance was paying about 3 times more for certain anesthesia services than Medicare was. Recent studies indicate that has increased to about 3.5 times more than what Medicare pays. Anesthesia providers can negotiate higher payments from private insurance for a number of reasons...
title: Anesthesia Services: Differences between Private and Medicare Payments Likely Due to Providers’ Strong Negotiating Position
